sentences: Armas sõber! Armsad kuulajad! Aga, armas inimene, sa ju lubasid!
"Armas hing, armu peab nõudma, mitte õigust," õpetas vaimulik.
Tema armsamaks toiminguks näis olevat võtta napsi .. J. Vahtra
context: The Estonian word 'lubasid' is the second person plural past tense form of the verb 'luba', meaning 'to promise'. It indicates that you (plural) made a promise or assurance in the past. This word appears in example sentences from the dictionary where it's used to show someone being reminded of a promise they had made.
